definitions.definition: To end; to come to an end.
definitions.example: The story concluded with a moral.

definitions.definition: To bring to an end; to close; to finish.
To bring about as a result; to effect; to make.
To come to a conclusion, to a final decision.
definitions.example: From the evidence, I conclude that this man was murdered.

definitions.definition: To make a final determination or judgment concerning; to judge; to decide.
To shut off; to restrain; to limit; to estop; to bar; generally in the passive.
definitions.example: A judgment concludes the introduction of further evidence.

definitions.definition: To include; to comprehend; to shut up together; to embrace.
To deduce, to infer (develop a causal relation)

definitions.example: The concluding chapters of the book summarise the main points.
